translation: kukła [a model or other object that represents someone, especially one of a hated person that is hanged or burned in a public place]
sentence: Crowds marched through the streets carrying burning effigies of the president.

translation: błagać [to try very hard to persuade someone to do something]
sentence: We would spend every meal time entreating the child to eat her vegetables.

translation: zakonnik [a man belonging to one of several Roman Catholic religious groups, whose members often promise to stay poor]
sentence: A brother Robert, the friar, was a Vermont citizen.
New witnesses have cast doubt on some of the evidence that sent the 19-year-old to the gallows.
Antibodies from the mother's milk line the baby's intestines and prevent infection.

translation: kończyna [an arm or leg of a person or animal]
sentence: The accident victims mostly had injuries to their lower limbs.
At night, the dark streets become menacing.

translation: przetrwać, przeżyć [to live or exist, or to stay energetic and determined, longer than another person or thing]
sentence: The empress outlasted all her children.

translation: wachlarz, przepych (też: pełna zbroja) [formal; a wide range or collection of different things]
sentence: There is a whole panoply of remedies and drugs available to the modern doctor.

translation: leżący twarzą w dół [lying with the face down and arms stretched out, especially as a sign of respect or worship]
sentence: She lay there prostrate, exhausted after a long day's work.

translation: dobre stosunki, wzajemne zrozumienie [a good understanding of someone and an ability to communicate well with them]
sentence: She has an excellent rapport with her staff.
He is a millionaire recluse who refuses to give interviews.
Of the crops tested, oat and rye grass yielded much more, on average, than the other crops.
Office supplies - staplers, paper clips and little things like that - are very hard to come by.

translation: służalczość [a willingness to do what other people want, or the act of considering your wishes as less important than those of other people]
sentence: She lives in total subservience to the men in her family.
